cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles NNE of Grand Cayman and 195 miles WSW of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northeast toward central Cuba tonight, then turning north-northwest and west while tracking directly toward South Florida and the Florida Keys Sunday night into Monday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida / Florida Keys (near or just north of the Keys to the Miami–Fort Lauderdale corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida coast from Deerfield Beach to Bonita Beach, and the Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas (including Florida Bay)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida coast from north of Golden Beach to Jupiter Inlet and from west of Chokoloskee to Bonita Beach, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast, Florida Keys, and portions of southwest Florida
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with gusts possibly reaching hurricane strength late Sunday night through Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible along the immediate Broward/Miami-Dade coast and within Biscayne Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 18 inches could produce flash and urban flooding over South Florida, including Port Everglades.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A tornado or two Sunday evening–night; hazardous seas, large swells and dangerous rip currents that will hamper port operations.
